sending_stone_messages.message: It'll be too easy by far to get lost in all that bogland. Focus on the search!
Nothing is more important than seeing the Red Wizards complete the portal ritual. Stay focused.
Just to be clear -- it's understood that your mission is to trigger Mount Tiamat's volcanic core, and to not kill us all at the same time. Yes?
All of us are counting on you. If the defenders of Mount Tiamat can't be drawn off, our task will be that much harder.
Hordes of red dragons will come to Tiamat's aid unless you can keep them occupied just a little while longer!
The number of undead pouring out of the tunnels might work against us or for us. We can try to turn them against the cult's forces!
The ritual is helping distract the chromatic dragons in the air! The metallic dragons are getting the upper hand!
The number of black dragons we're facing suggests you're letting too many of them escape! Finish the job!
Every magma vent and fissure in the Well of Dragons is erupting! Your plan has perhaps been a bit too successful!
First blood to our side! But it's far too early to call this fight over yet!
The blue wyrmspeaker has called so many of the blue dragons on his quest! His hatred of the Red Wizards is strengthening our attack!
The treants of the forest understand what's at stake in our battle against Tiamat. Find them! Appeal to their sense of justice! It's the only way!
You tearing through the forest is having a positive effect. Tiamat's forces are divided!
The ordered advance of Tiamat and her allies has the Cult of the Dragon locked down! We gain the edge against the Dragon Queen!
Hordes of red dragons will come to Tiamat's aid unless you can keep them occupied just a little while longer!
The black wyrmspeaker Rezmir controls some of Tiamat's most potent forces! Has she been dealt with yet?
The silence of the Draakhorn tips the balance of this fight back in our favor!
Tiamat is bloodied! We turn the tide of this fight!
The power of the ritual is triggering hidden defenses the Red Wizards set up in the Well of Dragons! All of it weakens Tiamat!
The white wyrmlings are swarming! They're in a state of panic as they flee the lava!
Tiamat knows it's over! But she means to take as many of us with her as she can!
Hordes of red dragons will come to Tiamat's aid unless you can keep them occupied just a little while longer!

active_game_rules: Only Champions with a WIS score of 10 or higher can be used

event_details.name: The Running
event_details.description: During the Running, four days in which most shops are closed and markets cancelled, apprentices and other workers visit parents, kin, or friends (that they can reach, and return from, within the four day period), taking with them food or drink so informal "family feasting" can occur when they get together. This is a time for catching up on family news and local gossip, showing children to grandparents, making deals and taking home payments or gifts, and so on.

details.freeplay_cost_desc: Free Play costs between 500 and 2500 Leaves to start

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Catti-Brie Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Catti-Brie (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Critical Hit
upgrades_to_display.description: Catti-brie has a 10% chance to critically hit with her basic attacks, dealing +100% damage.

upgrades_to_display.name: Mark for Death
upgrades_to_display.description: Enemies hit with Catti-brie's arrows take additional 100% damage from all Champions for 10 seconds; after being hit 10 times the enemy is stunned for 5 seconds.

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Spurt Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Spurt (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Wa-spiration
upgrades_to_display.description: Spurt's attacks (and those of nearby Champions when he's a Spirit), give Spurt ideas for new buffs to help the formation.

upgrades_to_display.name: Heroic Sacrifice
upgrades_to_display.description: When Spurt uses his ultimate attack, he dies. Spurt's Spirit replaces him in the formation and augments all his abilities until his ultimate is almost off cooldown.

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Krydle Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Krydle (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: From The Shadows
upgrades_to_display.description: Krydle increases the damage of Champions in the two rearmost columns in the formation.

upgrades_to_display.name: Charismatic Leader
upgrades_to_display.description: Krydle increases the damage of himself or others based on the CHA score of Champions in the formation.

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Shaka Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Shaka (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: A Celestial Puzzle
upgrades_to_display.description: Shaka attempts to solve a random Celestial Puzzle on every adventure, buffing all Champions.

upgrades_to_display.name: Celestial Resistance
upgrades_to_display.description: Shaka grants temporary hit points to all Champions in the party when they change areas.

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Dungeon Master Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Dungeon Master (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Patience, Young Ones!
upgrades_to_display.description: Dungeon Master buffs the damage of all Champions based on the number of Champions under 20 in the formation.

upgrades_to_display.name: Dungeon Master Rules
upgrades_to_display.description: Dungeon Master can be used in any adventure regardless of restrictions, he can also bring a Special Guest Star with them.

adventure_defines.name: The Devil Arrives
adventure_defines.description: Head into the wastelands and face Strahd head-on.
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "Into The Fire" Must have completed 22 Descent Into Avernus adventures or variants
adventure_defines.restrictions_text: Rudolph van Richten accompanies the Champions taking up a slot in the formation. Strahd arrives on horseback in each boss area. He is invulnerable until the area boss is defeated. Strahd must be defeated to advance. Only Champions with INT of 14 or higher can be used.

adventure_defines.restrictions_text: No restrictions

adventure_defines.name: Shaka's Puzzle
adventure_defines.description: Quest for a mystical and rare acorn while Shaka masters his puzzle
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Grandfather Acorn (Shaka)" Costs 625 Leaves to start
adventure_defines.restrictions_text: Shaka starts in the formation (slot 6). He can be moved. Only Shaka and the Champions who match the tag for their slot from Shaka's A Celestial Puzzle ability can deal damage; Shaka's A Celestial Puzzle starts out unlocked. Getting to know Shaka: Shaka's main ability is A Celestial Puzzle. It will tag 4 random slots with a specific tag. When you solve the puzzle and place a Champion that matches the tag, A Celestial Puzzle buffs the damage of the entire party by 100%. Match all the tags to give your party the biggest boost!

adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Grandfather Acorn (Shaka)" Costs 1250 Leaves to start
adventure_defines.restrictions_text: A Drow Wizard spawns in each area with the Blessing of Lolth. While the Drow Wizard is alive, all Drow enemies deal 300% additional damage and move 100% faster.

adventure_defines.restrictions_text: No restrictions

adventure_defines.name: Revenge of Venger
adventure_defines.description: Quest for a mystical and rare acorn with Venger on your tail!
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Grandfather Acorn (Dungeon Master)" Costs 1000 Leaves to start
adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Only Champions that are 40 years old or younger can be used.
At the start of each Boss area, Venger arrives on his nightmare as an additional boss that must be defeated.
Getting to know Dungeon Master: Dungeon Master is eligible for all adventures even if restrictions say otherwise. Try adding him to your formation to improve these youngsters!

adventure_defines.name: Ultimate Madness
adventure_defines.description: Quest for a mystical and rare acorn with Dungeon Master recharging your ultimate attacks!
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Grandfather Acorn (Dungeon Master)" Costs 2500 Leaves to start
adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Dungeon Master starts in the formation with his ultimate unlocked. He can be moved but not removed.
All Champion base attacks deal 99% less damage.
All Champion ultimate attacks deal 10,000% more damage.
Ultimate cooldowns take half as long.
Getting to know Dungeon Master: Dungeon Master's ultimate ability allows you to recharge another Champion's ultimate use. Use it to get the most out of your favorite damaging ultimate!

adventure_defines.name: It's Tiamat, the Dragon!
adventure_defines.description: Quest for a mystical and rare acorn while dealing with Tiamat, the Dragon!
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Grandfather Acorn (Dungeon Master)" Costs 5000 Leaves to start
adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Dungeon Master starts in the formation with Words of Encouragement unlocked. He can be moved but not removed.
Champions only regain 50% of their max hit points when changing areas.
At the start of each area, Tiamat has a 75% chance to show up. She briefly appears and breathes on the Champions, dealing 90% of the Champion's max health in damage if the Champion does not have any temporary hit points, but only wiping out the temp HP if they do.
Getting to know Dungeon Master: Dungeon Master grants temporary health at the start of areas when he doesn't run off to do his own thing. Use his specialization to make it more likely he sticks around if Tiamat is giving you grief.

campaign_defines.name: Baldur's Gate: Descent into Avernus
campaign_defines.description: Baldur's Gate has become gripped by the forces of Hell and needs a merry band of Champions to save the day.

campaign_defines.name: A Grand Tour of the Sword Coast
campaign_defines.description: Your introduction to the Sword Coast and beyond.

campaign_defines.name: Waterdeep: Dragon Heist
campaign_defines.description: There are rumblings of something big in Waterdeep.

quest_defines.description: The vision received by Duke Ulder Ravengard provides a point of hope amid the darkness -- but there'll be plenty of fighting before Elturel can be saved!
Another pack of giant rats presses in against the survivors in the dungeon refuge. Drive these vermin back!
A swarm of lesser imps are scouting for their infernal masters. Taking souvenirs from these tiny fiends might send them scattering.
The imps are in a panic -- but another pack of giant rats means to take advantage of the chaos!
The greater imp that leads this squad of devils enters the fray. Take all these fiends down!
Getting from Elturel down to the surface of Avernus promises to be an arduous journey -- and the servants of the Nine Hells are out in force to stop you!
Devil cultists swarm the ruins of the High Hall. Clear these fiend-worshipers out!
The meteor that tore through the High Hall was alive with infernal power. This area won't be safe for the survivors until these fragments are cleared out!
The ghouls that wander Elturel's empty streets have been drawn to the fighting here. Destroy these undead!
You have the cultists on the run -- but their infernal masters have arrived as reinforcements!
The lurching of the chains that bind Elturel is your chance to reach the surface! But the infernal forces that swarm the city are out in force and set to stop you!
A pack of Elturel ghouls swarms from the shadows, and the bearded devils that stalk you have a chance to regroup!
These bearded devils are relentless in their assault! Disarming them might be the only way to slow them down!
As the bearded devils fall back at last, another force of ghouls is drawn to the chaos of this fight!
The erinyes that leads these forces orders a final assault! Stand fast!
The sinking of the city creates a safe path for descent along one slackened chain. Sorry, a 'safe' path. But the devils fighting on the ground below are quick to ascend!
The bearded devils fall back under your onslaught. But packs of lesser imps slow your pursuit!
A wall of spined devils attempts to block your path. Breaking off the terrible spikes that are these devils' most potent weapon will break their resolve!
As fast as you force them back, the furious spined devils regroup!
A greater spined devil summons another wave of fiends to stand against you! Hit them hard!
Holding on while descending these massive chains is hard enough, even without this swarm of lesser imps trying to knock you off!
A strike team of bearded devils ascends the chains to end your threat. Hit them hard!
These vrocks will finish you off if they have the chance. Clip these demons' wings, and quickly!
The vrocks regroup for another assault. Stand fast!
This pit fiend's name seems frivolous, but its threat is potent! You need to push through!
The ground beneath Elturel has become a fiendish battlefield -- and you need to get past it if the city is to be saved!
A swarm of lesser imps breaks off from the main fight to focus on you! Hit them hard!
A strike team of devils homes in on your location. Claiming the ancient weapons they wield will lessen their threat.
Vrocks soar above the battlefield in search of choice targets -- and have spotted you!
A bone devil leads a pack of spined devils in an assault against the vrocks -- and you're caught in the middle!
The chaos of this Blood War battle shows no sign of breaking. Keep pushing through!
As fast as you carve your way through one force of devils, more push in to take their place.
A mob of dretches holds this section of the battlefield -- and each of the soul coins they collect represents a mortal life held in darkness. Grab them all!
A demonic assault force tries to push toward the center of the fray, crashing into you like a deadly wave!
The edge of the battlefield is in sight at last! But you'll need to fight your way past the chain devil wading into this horde of lesser demons to get clear!
As you begin your long journey across the hellscape of Avernus, flocks of stirges and swarms of abyssal flies rise to meet you -- and are hungry for mortal blood!
An imp scout party is drawn to the sound of your fighting. Don't let them take word of your location back to their masters!
As fast as you move, blood-hungry giant flies are even faster in pursuit! Clip the wings of these monstrous vermin to slow them down!
Escaping from the abyssal fly swarms becomes an endless slog as another flock of stirges presses in!
This infernal war machine will leave nothing standing in its path! Feonor's monstrous machine must be destroyed!
The Demon Grinder is destroyed! But Feonor and the infernal forces that rode with and followed her are out for blood!
You drive back the crawling claws that clung to the war machine, even as abyssal flies swarm out from the wreckage!
Breaking up the Demon Grinder's wreckage might help disperse the creatures still climbing out of it -- but a force of mezzoloths loyal to Feonor guard what's left of the infernal war machine!
You set a defensive line against the mezzoloths. But the crawling claws wash over you like a wave!
The mezzoloths regroup behind Feonor as the dark mage sets out to take her revenge!
Fort Knucklebone is in sight! But the crawling claws that have dogged you regroup for one final assault!
Even as the scouts of Fort Knucklebone prepare a welcome, the stirges regroup in search of wounded survivors!
A war machine scrap heap ahead is meant to slow the advancement of other war machines -- but will let this swarm of abyssal flies feast on you if you don't push through it!
Fort Knucklebone is straight ahead -- but a pack of redcaps is a most unwelcoming welcoming committee!
The redcaps fall back -- to let a fiendish flesh golem lurch forward into the fray!
Your goal is clear! The Twilight Grove must be found! But getting out of the fallen dragon's icy lair will be easier said than done!
The frost that covers these giant rats doesn't seem to slow them down. Watch out!
A goblin raiding party is looting this level -- and their cast-off goods will hem you in unless you clear them out!
Even as the goblins close to melee, diseased rats are drawn to the noise of your fight!
A giant centipede has laid claim to this hallway! You need to put this monster down quickly -- but these rats won't get out of your way!
Monstrous spiders of all kinds call these web-strewn hallways home -- and they don't appear too keen on welcoming visitors!
As fast as you drive these arachnids away, more of them scuttle in from the darkness!
Confining webs are closing in around you! Clear them out before you're trapped!
Two more packs of spiders press in! You're surrounded!
A skull-face spider looms at the center of this arachnid horde! Take this monster down!
As you push through spider territory, a final force of monstrous arachnids pursues you to the bitter end!
As you drive the giant spiders back, a hunting pack of wolf spiders appears behind you! It's an ambush!
These slime-covered goblins mean to slow you down, but you have no time to lose! Disarming these foes might make them reconsider this fight.
The faster you move, the harder the goblins pursue!
A deadly gelatinous cube is the source of all this slime. Take this ooze to the cleaners!
These diseased giant rats have been surviving on the dungeon's abandoned stores -- but they seem suddenly keen on fresh meat!
A second wave of rats hits you hard! Stand fast!
This goblin raiding party seems intent on setting up a watchpost here. Clearing out their supplies will send them packing!
Goblin reinforcements press in from all sides! Look sharp!
The goblin scout who leads these raiders rallies their troops for a last stand! Hit them hard!
Rats drawn to the sounds of combat are looking to pick off survivors. Send these rodents on their way!
As fast as you scatter them, more diseased rats press in!
These bugbears seem to have issue with you wanting to harvest the roots of their grove. Time for some delicate negotiations while you collect!
The alarm is sounded! More bugbears join the fray!
You have the bugbears on the run -- but a monstrous dire wolf shores up their counterattack!
It appears that you're not the only ones seeking the magic of the grove. You need to deal with these bandits before they can interfere with your plans!
As fast as you drive them back, the tenacious bandits quickly regroup!
A full squad of bandit wizards steps up to enter the fight! Depriving them of their stylish garb might rattle them!
The wizards fall back! But a force of bandit warriors sets up a new defensive line!
The captain and the wizard who lead this gang seem to have a lot on their mind. Give them some quality time -- far away from you!
Your route through the dungeon has led you to the heart of the goblin residential district! Watch yourselves!
Though many of the goblins seem anxious to let you pass, a number of malcontents are intent on proving their bravery against you. Push them back!
The darkness of these halls works to the goblins' advantage in a fight. Grab up this glowing fungi to light your way!
As fast as you push through them, the goblins regroup! Keep moving!
This goblin warleader seems intent on proving his mettle against you. Try to let him and his troops down easy!
A familiar stench tells you you're entering rat territory. Be on your guard!
As hard as you try to push through them, these diseased rats are relentless in their counterassault!
The rats fight from spite as much as from hunger. Collecting a few of their tails as trophies might shake their resolve!
These halls grow ever filthier as you advance. Watch your step!
A bloodthirsty rat is the alpha of this diseased pack! Take this monstrous rodent down!
This goblin scout party wasn't expecting you -- but they've got powerful backup close at hand!
These hobgoblins are fierce fighters -- and the twig blights swarming at the edge of the fray make for an even more lethal threat!
The hobgoblins have the advantage of numbers. Disarming them might be the only way to slow them down!
Your assault has the hobgoblins wavering, finally -- but goblin reinforcements quickly fill in the line!
This hobgoblin priest tries to inspire its followers for a frenzied final assault!
Twig blights from the Twilight Grove home in on you, as a force of goblin defenders does its best to lock down these halls!
As fast as you clear them out, more goblins and twig blights press in!
The goblins fall back at last -- but only to get their archers into position beyond impenetrable briars! Clear this unnatural ground cover out!
Goblin warriors press in while others continue to pepper you from range -- and all the while, the twig blights swarm!
Durnn talks a good game. Too bad for him that you didn't come to talk!
A promised shortcut might get you to Skullport quickly -- but even Undermountain's easy journeys are not for the faint of heart.
Vermin of all kinds are drawn to the sound of your passage. Look sharp!
The silk of these giant caterpillars makes a strong rope. Gather some up while you can.
The caterpillars don't take kindly to your theft of their silk! But scavenging land crabs block your escape!
A last cluster of caterpillars stands between you and the stairs! But the spiked monstrosity that lairs there offers a deadly welcome!
The route to the arch gate looks clear. Except for this massive bugbear melee you seem to have wandered into.
Monstrous crabs that lurk throughout this area have been driven forth by skirmishes between the bugbears and the drow -- and you're caught in the middle of them all!
The drow and the bugbears look set up for a long fight. Their rations will come in handy on your journey.
At each turn, another battle erupts around you! Watch out!
The orders of their leader have these drow ready for a last stand! And the bugbears aren't worried about catching you in the crossfire!
You've gotten clear of the drow and bugbear battleground -- but doing so has drawn you into the heart of drow territory!
The spiders that serve the drow enter the fray alongside their masters.
Drow cultists and rangers press you from all sides -- and these spiderwebs are hindering your escape. Tear them down!
As you fight to clear drow territory, an attack squad of dark elves and spiders is close behind!
The arrogance of this drow house captain spreads to his troops. Taking him out will help the drow reconsider their position in this fight.
More monstrous caterpillars have claimed these halls as their own. Fight on!
Giant flies on a hunting run catch sight of you from within the darkness!
These giant flies won't let up! Clipping their wings might help to even the odds!
Even as a last wave of giant flies swarms you, another scavenging pack of giant crabs enters the fray!
The arch gate should lie just beyond the cavern ahead -- but the crabs and their spiked leader have claimed this area as their own!
Getting to the arch gate means getting past this drow patrol! Hit them hard!
Bugbears in pursuit of the drow join the fray! It's a free-for-all, and you're caught in the middle!
As the bugbears fall back, you have a chance to push forward -- as soon as your specimen gathering is done.
The arch gate stands ready! But you'll need to run a deadly gauntlet to reach it!
The noise of the battle draws a deadly Undermountain hunter forth! You need to finish this battle before the gate closes again!
On the banks of the River Sargauth, you now know where all those crabs were coming from. Unfortunately, that now means you've got a fight on your hands.
The din of the crab fight draws forth swarms of bats from the shadows. Watch out!
An unseen spellcaster has laid down magic to welcome you. Watch yourselves!
You need to hit these giant crabs hard -- but another swarm of bats forces you back!
The magic of this sea hag is a potent threat! Take this creature down!
With the sea hag destroyed, the last of the giant crabs are running amok! Watch out!
Swarms of bats pursue you along the corridors of the Sargauth level -- and a hunting pack of giant rats has been drawn to the sound of your frantic flight!
As fast as you knock them down, the bats take to the air again. Clipping their wings will help keep them down.
The hunting crab pack is back! And eager to take up the chase!
The giant crabs begin to fall back -- but this ravenous carrion crawler is drawn to the fray and out for blood!
The tunnel slide has left you uninjured -- but surrounded by a Xanathar Guild patrol!
The skirmishes between the Xanathar Guild and the bugbears of Undermountain extend even to this level -- and you're caught right in the middle!
The fighters of the Xanathar Guild try to trap you against a barrier of smashed goods! Tear it down before you're trapped!
The drow you pursue fall into a bugbear ambush! But the bugbears aren't choosy about who they'll try to kill!
These Xanathar bugbears lead a frenzied owlbear on patrol -- and all of them want a piece of you!
Moving out along the shore of the river takes you out of Xanathar Guild territory -- and straight into a hobgoblin ambush!
As you push into the halls and away from the riverbank, the giant crabs hunting there become an unwelcome addition to the fray.
The endless slog through Undermountain is wearying. Thankfully, these giant crabs are both foe and food!
The last of the giant crabs make a stand -- but the Legion of Azrok returns for revenge!
This hobgoblin priest thinks his forces are a match for you! Explain his mistake in great detail!
Pushing past the hobgoblins leads you into spider territory -- and a most unwelcoming welcoming committee.
Your initial assault destroys the spider advance, but these ravenous arachnids quickly regroup!
The sound of madness heralds another aberration assault. Stay strong as you gather up tokens of those who have gone before you.
As fast as you drive them back, more of these gibbering mouthers lurch out of the darkness toward you.
As the gibbering mouthers swarm you, the manticore that controls this area reveals itself -- and sets its sights on your destruction!

sequence.text: That's quite tha tale ye're tellin', Duke Ravengard. Might o' had trouble believin' it under other circumstances. But tha place we're in, I can believe just about anythin' now.
It is a dark tale to be sure, Bruenor. All of this -- the fall of Elturel, this death and destruction -- all of it is Zariel's revenge, or so the Helm of Torm's Sight told me.
sequence.name: Ravengard

sequence.text: Look, I'm fairly clear on the history lesson. Zariel led the ride into Avernus, she felt betrayed when the Hellriders abandoned her, going all evil, and on and on. But can you walk me one more time through what Lulu was doing in the middle of all that?
I too would be interested in knowing more of this...
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: As I said, the vision showed me this hollyphant at Zariel's side. Before she fell and become what she is now, the archangel drove her sword into the ground of Avernus. An alabaster palace rose up around it. Then I saw Lulu wandering, and meeting up with two birdlike humanoids.
sequence.name: Ravengard

sequence.text: I don't... but yes...! I remember now. The Sword of Zariel! It holds a spark of her goodness still! And with that... I don't know. Oh, it's gone now. I'm so sorry...
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: Don't ye fret now, Lulu. We'll figure this out, workin' together like. But fer right now, we got trouble closer at hand. Look sharp!
That's the last of the rats. We need to get all the survivors to regroup. With Duke Ravengard leading them, they should be able to hold off the worst of the devils' assault for a time.
Devils and demons fight each other, make it easier. Survivors stay safe, hold back. This will purchase us time we need.
But how much time? Lulu, are ye gettin' any more o' yer memories back?
Shards and pieces, Bruenor. But I see it. I see the sword, and the citadel that protects it. It holds the key to... to ending Zariel's threat. But I don't want... I don't know what that means.
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: If there's a spark of Zariel the archangel's goodness still within the blade, hold onto hope, Lulu. We may be able to undo this evil.
But if not... if Zariel is to be destroyed...
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: This isn't the time for worrying about that, Lulu. Just keep your mind clear, and seek for any memory of the birdfolk from Duke Ravengard's vision. If we can find someone who saw which way you came from Zariel's last battle, we might be able to determine where her sword was cast down.
Devils everywhere... nowhere to run...
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: Stay strong, Lulu. Stay at my side now.
But she bid me to flee. She drove me away and into the wastes... wandering so long... I... yes! The wasteland! The fortress! I remember now!
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: Best ye hold onto that memory fer a moment, little hollyphant. We got ta finish this fight before it finishes us!
Lulu, what is it? What do you remember?
The kenku! Chukka and Clonk! They found me in the wastes. We came to a fortress, like a great hand clawing up from the ground.
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: A great hand... my friends, I've seen this! From the city's edge, looking out. A great hand of stone stands in the infernal wastes, no more than ten miles distant by its look.
sequence.name: Pherria

sequence.text: Yes! Fort Knucklebone they called it... someone called it... but I don't remember.
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: Lulu, you've remembered all you needed to for now. My friends, we have our destination. Duke Ravengard, we leave the city to your protection. Will you be safe?
As safe as we can be, Celeste. The survivors have regrouped. The demonic assault is keeping the devils distracted, for now. Go with speed, and all our blessings.
sequence.name: Ravengard

sequence.text: We'll take whatever good thoughts ye got, duke. Let's move, everyone! We gotta figure out how ta get down off this floatin' city. Then we've got some questin' ta do.
Are you all right, Bruenor? You seem especially thoughtful.
Aye. Just ponderin' on what this shield's been sayin' ta me, ta reinforce some o' Ravengard's tale.
The Shield of the Hidden Lord? The fiend trapped within it hasn't said a word since we left Baldur's Gate.
'Cause it knew we was bringin' it home ta tha Nine Hells. Not claimin' ta be no angel no more, even. Says its name's Gargauth. And it's willin' ta help us find Zariel's Sword if we set it free.
A deal with a devil. Not the first we might have to make before all this is done. Do you trust this fiend?
Nay, but I'll keep listenin'. Maybe if it gets desperate 'nuff, it'll let somethin' slip that might help us. But till then, I can see some infernal negotiatin' comin' up that's more me style!
I can see the courtyard ahead. It's crawling with more cultists, and worse.

It looks like they're trying to lock down control over this area. If we clear them out, Duke Ravengard's forces will be able to set up a perimeter and hold off further incursions. Champions! Time to take back the High Hall! For Elturel!
Finish these fiends, Champions! Send them back to the darkness before they can regroup!
We got clear streets all around tha market. But is that more o' them movin' in behind us?
Those are Ravengard's forces. The survivors have reclaimed the High Hall.
That's our cue ta move, then. We gotta find a place ta scout tha ground below, and ta figure out how we're gonna fly all o' us down... wait... do ye feel that?
A trembling in the great earthmote. The chains that hold the city are drawing us down again.
Nay! There's a bigger tremor comin'! Everyone hang on ta somethin'!
Minsc still hangs on, but still feels like things are falling!
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: Something must have happened to the chains. The city's being dragged down on one side.
But them tremors has stopped. Pretty sure that means we're stuck this way fer a while, with one side o' Elturel lower than tha other. And that means a couple o' them chains must be runnin' slack...
I'm pretty sure I know where you're going with this, and I'd just like to point out that the fly spell is easily cast and quite utilitarian...
Best we save our casters fer things more important. Everyone, follow me! I got an idea fer gettin' us down tha easy way!
All this tilted walking is more difficult than it looks. Rubble on streets is all loose and slidey.
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: Just focus on the workout your calves are getting. And hope we don't have to walk uphill to get back once the futility of this plan of Bruenor's is revealed.
Ye complain now, but ye'll be applaudin' me good thinkin' later, elf. We just need ta get ta tha low edge o' tha city, then we'll be walking down them chains, nice and easy.
There they are! The mortal Champions! Circle around! Hold them here and destroy them all!
sequence.name: Erinyes

sequence.text: So is this the nice part or the easy part? I get confused sometimes...
Aye and look -- we're here. And see them chains? Straight as a road!
I'm seeing, and that road is made of frictionless infernal iron and swarming with fiends. So, no. Fly spell, anyone? Asharra? Dhadius? Who's got spell slots?
Less fearful stallin' and more controlled fallin', elf. Let's go!
No, let go of me! Bruenor!
This is madness! I can barely keep my footing!
Just stick close, Jarlaxle. If we all hang on to someone else, it'll help everyone stay more stable.
Yes, I was hanging on to Deekin a moment ago. Now my wallet's gone missing.
Everybody just focus on tha fightin' and tha footwork! We're halfway down!
Ha! You see, devils are falling back. They know they cannot stop Champions from their quest! Wait, what is screeching sound getting louder?
Vrocks inbound! It looks like the devils are subcontracting the whole stopping-our-quest thing...

Them vrocks is scattered, but tha devils is back. And looks like they got a pit fiend leadin' them ta try ta block us gettin' down. Listen ta them chantin' that fiend's dark name. What is it they're sayin'?
It sounds like... Lucille.
Seems unlikely. Ye right sure about that?
Well, we've climbed down quite a ways. My ears might still need to depressurize.

Finally down! Solid ground never felt so good. Sweet, sweet red-black earth. No, wait -- red-black sand. Made of bits of ground-up bone... congealed ichor... all right, looking for a fly spell again. Anyone?
This is the Blood War in microcosm. Devils and demons destroying each other in an endless conflagration, fighting over untold centuries. The forces of the Abyss have laid claim to Elturel.
Then let's hope this fiendish conflict buys us the time to reach Fort Knucklebone and learn what we need to learn. Come on!
We're not making any headway! They're pinning us down!
Nay, we're gainin' ground! Tha fightin' is most frenzied down near tha river. Just keep tha Styx at yer back and keep movin'!
I can see open ground ahead. If we can push past this chaos, we have a chance!
Nearly there! Hit anythin' ye can reach! When these demons figure out they're fightin' a losin' battle, they'll scatter!
It looks like one of the devil commanders has the same idea! Watch yourselves!
Keep movin'! We gotta keep them battlin' fiends behind us. 'Cause tha road ahead ain't lookin' none too hospitable.
Behold, friends. The open hellscape of Avernus. Travel will be difficult here. Enemies stand at every turn. This journey will harrow all in body and soul, and you will wish for death before the end!
Squeak?
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: My sorry, and apologies. Boo reminds me I am thinking of Waterdeep Dock Ward during Fleetswake celebrations. We will be fine here.
The resources we obtained from Candlekeep should help us navigate these infernal wastes. And Lulu may prove useful, as her memories return.
Yes... but no... all familiar, but strange. Still, I think... yes! This is the way. Fort Knucklebone can be seen from the air. I will scout, and you follow. Come, Champions!
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: That's the last of the imps on the run. But these accursed flies won't let up. We need to keep... watch out!
Oi! Where'd ye come from out o' nowhere, friend?
I'm the warlord Feonor. And hardly your friend, outworlder. I teleported, naturally. Wondering who was out here. Not sure you worth the spell, though.
sequence.name: Feonor

sequence.text: What in Tyr's name... that umbrella she's carrying. It's made of... flesh and bone...
Enough. You bore me. All of you. Too bad.
sequence.name: Feonor

sequence.text: And she's teleported out again. But to where?
We keep movin', hopefully we can manage ta not worry about it. That one gave me tha creeps, I don't mind admittin' it.
This excursion across Avernus is combining the worst part of every excursion we've ever made with the other worst parts of every other excursion we've ever made.
Less deridin' and more longstridin', elf. This infernal landscape seems made ta wear us down.
I wouldn't mind so much if anything in that landscape resembled a landmark... no, wait. There's something.
Fort Knucklebone? By all that's holy, we must be getting close.
No, this is something smaller. Something moving. Some kind of... vehicle...?
And which way's it headin'?
I'll give you one guess, and short odds on 'Straight toward us!'
By me gran's favorite mine cart! What in tha name o' long-distance haulin' is that?
Loaded with fiends and undead... bristling with weapons... it's some kind of infernal war machine! Oh, and look who's at the wheel.
Do you fancy a race, outworlders? Then run from the Demon Grinder if you like. You might bore me a bit less.
sequence.name: Feonor

sequence.text: Oi! That magic loudhailer she's got is ear-splittin'.
The engine on the machine is louder still -- and it's on a course to run us down!
That's it! We done it! Listen ta that engine grindin' down!
It's not grinding down, it's burning out! Everybody scatter!

Can't say I thought much o' that infernal Demon Grinder while it was rollin'. But it makes a mighty impressive pile o' wreckage when it finally stops. Did that Feonor go down with tha ship, so ta speak?
Insolent outworlders! I will make you pay for this outrage! Mahadi will make you pay for their Demon Grinder's destruction!
sequence.name: Feonor

sequence.text: I'm going to take that as a 'no...'
That's the last threat this Feonor will make. But this is all strange. What in Tyr's name are these machines? What are they used for?
Infernal war machines. Vehicles forged for battle in the Nine Hells. Fueled by the souls of the damned... so terrible...
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: The name the mage mentioned. 'Mahadi.' Do you know it, Lulu?
I think... I know... but no, Celeste. I'm sorry.
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: Not to worry. We'll no doubt find some of the answers we seek in Fort Knucklebone -- and hopefully some clue to where the Sword of Zariel might be found.
There, straight ahead! There's our stone fist on the horizon. Or whatever passes for the horizon in this infernal landscape.
I'd call that close by, but it ain't easy judgin' distance in this place. But either way, tha faster we move, tha faster we get there.
Oh, yes! Move quickly!
sequence.name: Pins

sequence.text: Wouldn't want to be stuck out here! All alone!
sequence.name: Needles

sequence.text: What in... more imps?! Ye tiny fiends has been followin' us through all this hellish landscape?
Not following, no. Waiting!
sequence.name: Pins

sequence.text: Watching and waiting. And time now to let the others know!
sequence.name: Needles

sequence.text: Blast it! They're movin' fast fer tha fort. Come on, before they make trouble!
Stop right where you are! Fort Knucklebone's no handy waystation for mortal scum. Clear off and keep moving!
sequence.name: Redcap

sequence.text: My fey friend, if you're an emissary of some sort, please be assured that our journey is an important one. We seek someone who might be known in the fort. Two Kenku, Chukka and Clonk?
Typical. Those two scavengers will invite any riffraff in. Redcaps! Send these outworlders on their way!
sequence.name: Redcap

sequence.text: What tha... look at all them fey! What's they all doin' in this infernal place?
Probably a good question to ask after they've finished attacking! Watch out!
We're here. Lulu, is this it?
This is it! Fort Knucklebone! I remember... I remember...
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: What is ye remember, Lulu? We're on dangerous ground here, and can use all tha insight we can get.
Watch yourselves! The gates are opening, and... what is that?
Ha! Say hello to Mickey! Flesh golem stitched together from the body parts of fiends! Boo yah!
sequence.name: Redcap

sequence.text: I remember no one at Fort Knucklebone likes visitors! They're attacking!
sequence.name: Lulu

sequence.text: Well, nice ta know we don't have ta tone down our response ta this warm welcome. Everybody, hit these blighters hard!
That fiendish golem is backin' off finally. Judgin' by that limp, looks like we hurt 'em good 'nuff. But there's someone else at tha gate. Some kind o' hag. Watch yerselves!
Enough! What is this disturbance? How dare you bother my poor Mickey.
sequence.name: Mad Maggie

sequence.text: How dare we bother... that golem almost took my head off! And who names a flesh golem 'Mickey'?

Mad Maggie does, outworlder. And you should expect more of the same welcome if you don't clear out of my fort. Strangers wandering out of the wastes, looking like something the cat dragged in... oh, my...
sequence.name: Mad Maggie

sequence.text: What cat now? Are we under attack again? Look out fer cats!
No, Bruenor. Look. It seems that this Mad Maggie recognizes Lulu...
Yes. It's been a long time, hasn't it hollyphant? But quickly, you'd all best get inside the gates. This will be an... interesting reunion.
sequence.name: Mad Maggie

sequence.text: We need to get moving. There's no telling what lies between us and the Twilight Grove -- or what we'll find when we get there. Erky, you were speaking of other prisoners who were captured with you. You think they were sent to the grove?

More than sure. Three adventurers, they were. Came to the Sunless Citadel on the same mission as you -- to discover the source of those evil apples. Some hobgoblin chief took them. The goblins said he worked for the dark druid, Belak the Outcast. It was Belak who wanted the prisoners, and alive.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Right. Let's get loaded and ready, then. Looks like we got some dungeon sloggin' ta do, but with that Meepo as a guide, we should make good time.
No! Meepo not go. Meepo heartbroken, and must grieve loss of beautiful Calcryx. No more adventures for Meepo. No more...
sequence.name: Meepo

sequence.text: Oi. I can get as choked up as tha next dwarf about losin' a lovin' pet, but that dragon hated ye! She woulda killed ye if we hadn't stepped in.
Meepo and Calcryx had... complicated relationship...
sequence.name: Meepo

sequence.text: Sorry to interrupt, but that shrieking sound getting closer has me a bit on edge...
Well, that kobold's scarpered, sure 'nuff. So much fer a guide.
We'll make do, Bruenor. We have enough trackers in the group, and plenty of tracks to follow.
Too many tracks, Celeste. Is chaos, this ground. But Minsc and Boo will persevere!
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: That's the last of the goblins fled. Erky, will following them lead us to the grove?
That's a strong maybe, but I'm afraid I don't know. Some of the goblins work for Belak, but most of those ruffians are out only for themselves.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Tracking the fruit they were selling is of paramount importance. We can't allow any more of those cursed apples to reach the surface world.
Aye. While I was imprisoned, it was the winter apple I heard them speak of. The white apple of death. It was said to be nearly ready.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Then it sounds like we got some fruit pickin' ta do. Come on.
Tracks continue this way. Definitely the clear path through here.
I think we might need to discuss a basic definition of 'clear.' Those webs ahead are so thick I can't even see through them.
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: But is perfect that way. Maximum obscuring means foes cannot see us as we approach. Come! Follow Minsc, all!
Oh, this is going to be a very long trip...
Finally, we're clear of that web-infested ruin. I don't think I'll ever get these clothes clean. But I can see clearer hallways ahead.
You'd be better to keep an eye out behind. The spiders are hot on our trail. We need to move!
Them spiders is breakin' finally. Elf, can ye see 'em goin'?
Yes, they're back to their own territory. Now we just need to worry about what's ahead of us.
Minsc has good guess on that. Look! Goblin tracks are here.
Those are halfling tracks, actually. My tracks, in fact. I'm standing right here.
Sorry. Look! Goblin tracks are over there.
Oh, lovely. But you're right, those are goblin footprints... and there's something off about them. What is that? Slime?
Feh. Ye wanna be careful touchin' that stuff, even wearin' gloves, elf.
No worries, Bruenor. They're your gloves. And you can take them back because you're going to need them! Slime-covered goblins moving in!
We got 'em on tha run! Now form up on me and hit these slimy blighters hard!
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: What is ahead? Is nothing there to threaten about, Boo. You are worry-hamster, I tell you.
I normally like to never take the side of rodents during an argument, but hold up. I think Boo's spotted something... something glistening...
Lotta muck on top o' these here dungeon stones, but me dwarf senses is tellin' me we're goin' in circles. Minsc, are ye sure ye got us on tha right track?
Minsc is confident. Tracks lead on this way. Four toes, sharp claws. Clearly rat.
I thought you were following the goblins' tracks?
We follow goblin tracks, and Minsc sees where goblins take off hunting rats. Now follow rats to get back to goblins. Try to keep up, drow. We have no time to waste!
Looks like Minsc was right. There's goblins dead ahead!
That's not a scouting party. They're hunkered down, waiting for an assault.
Well, good thing they got one comin', then. Everyone ta me! Then charge!
The goblins are breaking. The main force is headed toward that hall straight ahead.
Then let's stay on 'em. 'Tis a safe bet that even if they ain't goin' ta tha Twilight Grove, they're lookin' ta report ta someone who will be. Come on!

The dark magic in the ground here is growing almost tangible as we get closer to the Gulthias Tree. These sickly roots... I'd like to get samples of these for study. They might grant insight into how to destroy the tree when we find it.
You'll need to collect quickly, I'm afraid. Trouble ahead! Well, more trouble than normal, I mean. I can see a bugbear squad moving in.
Bugbears! We are getting close to the grove. The goblins talked about the bugbears who took over their clan being in league with Belak.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Then let's give Celeste a hand while we get up close and personal with these blighters. We got business with their boss, and time's a-wastin'!
Them bugbears is boltin'. So followin' them should lead right ta where we wanna be.
Hold up! There's someone else ahead, coming down that side passage.
Look sharp there! Another company ahead. Mercenary adventurers by their look. You rabble! Clear yourselves out and back to the surface. This dungeon has been claimed by the Black Rock Gang.
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: I know that name. Bandits and reprobates, every one of you. What's your business here?
Wouldn't you like to know, knight? We're not here for the goblins' magic apples, that's for sure.
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: What are... you just told them we're here for the apples! Now they'll want them too.
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: No, I said we weren't here for the apples. That's called 'bluffing.' Don't you know anything? How you ever got to run this gang is beyond me.
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: Well, this is entertaining, but we're on a schedule. Everyone to me! Then clear these brigands out!
There's too many of them! We need to break off!
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: What's that, more bluffing? So subtle. I'm sure they'll fall for it this time.
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: You're always like this, every time we do a raid. I get nothing but criticism from you!
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: Oh, that's rich. You ever listen to yourself? Every order I give, there you are with, 'Are you sure you want to do that?'
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: I ain't got no idea what's goin' on with these two, but I'm thinkin' we need ta put an end ta this. Everybody line up! Then get these ruffians headin' fer tha doors!
That bandit set-to cost us time. But the goblin tracks are still thick on the ground here.
There's light comin' from ahead. And voices. Lots and lots o' voices...
There are so many of them fleeing from us. This place is in a state of pandemonium.
Most of these are just villagers, not fighters. If we give them space, they'll hopefully clear out on their own.
Be good if that works fer most o' them. But in me experience with goblins, there's always some o' them got somethin' ta prove...
Hold, interlopers! You think you can attack the heart of goblin territory and just walk away.
sequence.name: Goblin Warleader

sequence.text: We're trying to run away, curse you! We have no quarrel with you, but you keep throwing yourselves in our way and attacking!

Typical surface-worlder. Too cowardly to fight, too brazen to ever give up. Well, now you're in a ring of goblin steel and we'll see how you like it. Then we'll deliver you all to Durnn and you'll get what you deserve.
sequence.name: Goblin Warleader

sequence.text: Durnn! That was the hobgoblin chief. The one who took the prisoners away.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Then it sounds like we got our own meetin' set up with that chief already. But we gotta clear these goblins out first. Come on!
Ye're sure them goblins ain't followin' us?
No sign of them. Either we scared them off or they're confident this Durnn will take care of us.
Hopefully word gets to him that we're on our way. If we're lucky, he'll come to us and we can end this search.
Still feel like we're side-trackin' too much. These halls is a maze. Best be on guard fer whatever lies ahead.
Good news, I can see what look like rat-free hallways ahead. Bad news, we need to get through that mob ahead to reach them.
Monster rat! Hungry rat! Doom!
Feh. We got this far through these rodents and ain't no worse fer wear. Time ta push through tha last o' them and be done with it. Let's go!
That was a tougher fight than it had any right ta be. These goblinoids is better trained than some o' them we fought before.
If this is the home territory of this Durnn, these are likely his best defenders. We've got a fight on our hands, I think.
Watch out! Deekin scout ahead and see shouty magic hobgoblin! Very dangerous!
Pretty sure that means there's some kind of spellcaster leading this group. Yes, just there.
Surface-worlders! You dare trespass onto the territory of the Durbuluk tribe? You will all of you die!
sequence.name: Hobgoblin Priest

sequence.text: No one's ever happy to see us. So disheartening.
Listen while you can, priest. We have business with your chief, Durnn. And with the evil you serve in the Twilight Grove. But you can make this easy on yourselves if you wish. Stand down.
Insolence! The Durbuluk do not stand down to the likes of you. This citadel is ours! And I will make offerings to Maglubiyet of your hearts when this is done!
sequence.name: Hobgoblin Priest

sequence.text: There's a wall of goblinoids to all sides of us. And they're ready to fight.
Looks like ye was right, Nayeli. We sent a message earlier that's got that Durnn comin' ta us.
Stay close, everyone. Keep an eye out for the prisoners. There's no turning back now.
Fools. You think you can stand against the might of the Durbuluk?
sequence.name: Durnn

sequence.text: Durnn, we would be happy to stand with the Durbuluk if you cease these hostilities. There's a greater evil here than you realize. If you help us destroy the Gulthias Tree and deal with Belak the Outcast, we might still make a peaceful solution to all this.

Your words are as hollow as your threat, cleric. I heard that same pleading from the adventurers who preceded you down here. Though the loudest of them quieted when I killed him. And the other two... well, they won't be saying much now.
sequence.name: Durnn

sequence.text: Don't waste your time, Celeste. This one's evil, through and through. But those who follow him might have a change of heart once they see their master fall!

That's tha last o' them goblinoids scatterin'. Could tell that a lot o' them dinna have their hearts in this fight. Safe bet that this Durnn took over by force and bloodshed. And even goblins get tired o' that sooner or later.
Friends! Minsc and Boo take point, scout ahead. Strange halls there are below us. Dark magic there.
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: It's the Twilight Grove. I can feel its evil even from here.
Durnn spoke of murdering one of the prisoners. Was he just boasting, do you think?
It's hard to say. But we'll find out soon enough. Get ready, my friends. The Gulthias Tree is beneath us -- and must be destroyed for the sake of all.
Can't help but wonder if that goblin's lore was all balderdash. We been over this area three times, and there ain't no sign o' any last shortcut ta any magic gate.
Glom's directions were perfectly accurate up to this point, and she had no reason to lie.
I think I'm done tapping walls looking for secret doors. My fingernails are taking a beating, and we haven't passed a salon in ages.
Sir? Mr. Jarlaxle?
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: Squiddly, I've told you before, don't interrupt when the grown-up Champions are talking.

But it's just that I think we found something. You told us before to stay in the middle and stare at the floor, and down in all this rubble strewn about, here's this pole with writing carved in it, and a map tied to it.
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: Indeed? Sounds like another excellent idea on my part, then.
Oi! Don't mean ta interrupt, but is anyone else hearin' a squeakin'? And is it gettin' closer?
Right, while the rats are rethinking their strategy, let's have a look at the writing on this pole. 'In case of emergency, use on the arch gate.' Brief and to the point.
An arch gate! Glom was right, bless her. The arch gates are Undermountain's permanent teleportation portals. And this map shows the route to the nearest one, straight through this level.
We'll need to be on our guard even if we find it. Many of Halaster's arch gates carry a surprise for those who try to use them.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Well, I stand ashamed o' ever doubtin' tha word o' our duplicitous goblin criminal, then. If this shortcut o' hers pans out, we got a chance o' makin' up fer lost time.
Let's hope so. But even as a shortcut, this route still leaves a lot of Undermountain to cover.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Anyone else hearing a strange clattering sound?
Reminds me of that time I was cutting purses at the Sea Ward Tap Dance festival.
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: Well, let's hope whatever we're facing today is slightly less horrifying...
The crabs are falling back. We need to get to those stairs. Everyone move!
It looks like whatever memo the crabs got, the caterpillars missed.
Feh! These critters ain't got what it takes ta stand against steel. Hit 'em hard!
The bugbears are regrouping. Can we push past them?
Past the bugbears? Absolutely. Past the drow scout party creeping up to ambush the bugbears? Less likely.
Looks like we showed up in tha middle o' someone else's fight. Ye think there's any chance that they're so set on killin' each other that they'll just let us wander on through?
Look sharp! The bugbears have mercenary scum in their employ! Send them a volley!
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: Well, we can certainly give that question some thought. But in the meantime, duck!
Adventurers. Always treading where you don't belong. But know this -- all Undermountain will fall under the rule of the Spider Queen in time.
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: Can't say I'd be all that bothered 'bout Lolth and Halaster Blackcloak goin' toe ta toe and accidentally leavin' tha world a safer place fer tha rest o' us. But in tha meantime, try ta get it through yer pointed-eared skull, drow -- we ain't here ta fight ya!
We're looking for a way out of Undermountain, and as quickly as possible. Just let us go our way and we can avoid further bloodshed.
Beg for your lives all you like, surface-world scum. It'll only make killing you more enjoyable.
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: Finally! Bugbears and drow, both on tha run!
I wouldn't count the drow out. They'll regroup under whatever would-be leader sees the opportunity for advancement.
Then best we get moving before they regain their full strength and numbers. Come on!
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Intruders! All warriors, to me! Make up formation!
sequence.name: Drow House Captain

sequence.text: Lovely. This one fancies himself a tactical type.
Feh. We dropped 'nuff o' these blackguards so far. We'll just keep that tally open a while longer.
Don't get overconfident. This will be a tougher fight than against those scouts.
And they've got giant spiders with them! Would you look at that!
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: Your enthusiasm is delightful, Squiddly. But for the time being, channel that energy into getting back to Jenks and Nat, and keep each other safe!
Keep at them! These house lackeys don't know enough to quit the fight while they're ahead.
Traitor! What house did you flee from to join forces with these surface-world scum?
sequence.name: Drow House Captain

sequence.text: Oh, that's a very long story. And I'm afraid you're not going to be around long enough to hear it all.
Sanctimonious exile. I'll take your head for whatever paltry reward is offered for it. Warriors! Kill them all!
sequence.name: Drow House Captain

sequence.text: Look! I think something's moving in the dark ahead. Something flying.
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: Ye got good eyes, lad. Jarlaxle, ye see anythin' past what tha boy and I can?
Well, given the number of giant caterpillars crawling around this level, I'm holding out hope that giant butterfly season is suddenly upon us.
And?
And I'm right! Except for the butter part...
I know we've all been a bit distracted lately, but is anyone actually keeping an eye on that map?
I've got it, Jarlaxle. We're on track, and getting close to the arch gate.
With tha number o' creatures we gotta bash through ta get there, I'm thinkin' this shortcut weren't as short as all that.
It'll still get us to Skullport more quickly than any other route -- and perhaps even ahead of Nihiloor. There's been no sign that he passed this way.
Let's hope ye're right. And let's keep movin'!
There it is! The arch gate! Celeste and I should be able to determine how to activate it.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Well, I'm sure the rest of us could use a short break while you do. Thankfully, we have no distractions.
Daggers! Look out!
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Less prattlin', more battlin', elf. We gotta clear these drow out, and right quick!
The magic of the gate is tied to the chamber somehow. There's a connection, but it's not arcane.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: The fungus growing here... it's no species I know. Does it have some magical nature that's meant to fuel the gate?
Only one way to find out. Everyone! Grab up as much fungus as you can, and quickly!
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Be careful... the magic of the arch is shifting. Celeste, strike it with the pole the children found, now!
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: The gate is opening! We've done it!
'Cept there's a wall o' drow between tha rest o' us and it. How long's it gonna stay open, ye reckon?
I don't know. Which means we need to fight!
Nearly there! Keep hittin' hard, Champions! Whichever side breaks first, we make our move!
Sorry if this doesn't seem like the right time, but does anyone else think that gateway looks odd? What's that shimmering?
Looks like magic is supposed ta look ta me, and no surprise there. Focus on tha fight, elf! We're runnin' out o' time!
We have the advantage! Everyone, move now!
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Hurry, Champions! Children, stay close to me!
Am I still the only one with a bad feeling about this?
Hey! Mr. Jarlaxle is right! That shimmering looks like...
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: It's water! I just put my hand in!
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Water? I don't understand...
We've got no time to debate it! The gate's closing! Everyone, go!!!
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Champions, count off! Is anyone still in the river?
It looks like everyone's present and accounted for, the children included. Just a bit wet.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Does this river run across the entire level?
Aye. It's the River Sargauth, and it'll lead us straight to Skullport.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Too bad we ain't got a boat. Sailin' would get us there in no time.
Not for me. The number of creatures trying to kill you from both banks would make it a short trip. I'd go with a submarine, though. Something sleek. Comfortable. Cool color scheme.
Really? Never thought o' ye as tha submarinin' type, elf. Ain't really yer style is it?
I could pull it off.
There's magic ahead, and it's powerful. There's a spellcaster nearby.
You mean at that barrier?
I'll put even odds on that barrier being an illusion. There's something not quite right about it.
And it's concealing some sort of magical trap. We need to take it down, but carefully.
Something's moving along the shore, getting into position.
That's a sea hag! I'm guessing that's our spellcaster.
Then we need to get past these crabs to get to her. Come on!
Finally got them crabs scuttlin' back ta wherever they came from. Maybe we can catch a moment's rest.
I wouldn't count on it. There's a disturbingly familiar flapping sound getting closer.
And there's that squeaking we heard before too. I remember that's rats!
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Very good, Jenks. So what are we facing?
Flying rats!
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Close, but not quite there yet. We'll keep working.
These giant crabs are beginning to wear on me. Someone threaten them with nutcrackers and garlic butter. Maybe they'll take the hint.
I think I've got some peanut butter in my pocket. Would that help?
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: Not so much. Also, ick. Also, stay back!
Pretty sure none o' us is gonna have any appetite by tha time this fight's done. That's a carrion crawler! Everybody close up ranks and hit this monster hard!
I didn't know they made monsters so big. When that crawler thing fell, I felt the ground shake!
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Me too, lad. But that weren't tha crawler. Everybody ta me! Tha place is collapsin'!
The floor's giving way! We're being drawn down a side tunnel. Hang on!
Everybody all right? That were a mild slide as slides go.
Everyone seems to be accounted for, and no worse for wear.
I think I have rocks in my underwear...
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: [Signs]
sequence.name: Nat

sequence.text: Nat says that's a step up from having rocks in your head like usual.
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Well, our collective devil-may-care sense of humor certainly survives. That's a plus.
Oi! Look sharp and hold tha laughin' fer later. We got company!
These Xanathar Guild thugs are even thicker on the ground here than they were before.
The guild's smuggling operations must be based in this area. We're going to draw more resistance the farther we push through them.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Then we'll just keep pushin' harder. Come on!
Mr. Jarlaxle, sir! I hear a 'who' again! That's an owlbear! I made notes from before!
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Well done, Jenks. Now kindly take Squiddly and Nat and get behind this wall of Champions. I'd like to stop having to remind you.
Touchin' ta see them kids tryin' ta carry their weight. They got heart, I'll give 'em that.
As long as we don't end up carrying them out of here, I'll be happy. Bugbear hunting pack! Dead ahead!
Am I delirious from combat exhaustion, or have we actually driven these Xanathar Guild maniacs back?
Can't say ye're not seein' things, but if ye are, I'm seein' 'em too. That's tha last o' them fled or fallen. Maybe tha rest o' this road'll be a mite easier.

I wouldn't count on that yet. The Xanathar Guild isn't the only group with collective eyes on controlling this level -- and I wouldn't expect those the guild has defeated to accept their losses lightly.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Fighting our way through this hobgoblin horde is costing us too much time. We need to try to talk to them.
That one on the far side of the fray looks like leadership material. Judging by the way he's pushing other people into the fight.

Oi! Hobgoblin! Ain't neither side here got anythin' ta gain from this fight goin' on any longer than it needs ta. What do ye say we talk about ye letting' us pass through yer territory? On top o' no more o' ye dying, maybe we can make it worth yer while.
Prattling sun-siders! We are of the Legion of Azrok, and we will hold this territory against all intruders! Fall to your knees and we may take mercy on you. Or stand and die!
sequence.name: Hobgoblin Priest

sequence.text: Well, that's another successful negotiation session. Well done, everyone.
Less yakkety-yak, more sneak attack, elf. Champions! Hit these blighters with everythin' ye got!
Feh. Look at 'em go. That priest and his legion are quick ta flee when they know they're about ta be beat.
We should take advantage of their retreat while we can. Keep moving, Champions!
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: You mercenary outworlders think you're the first to try to break the will of the hobgoblins of Sargauth? Xanathar Guild treachery, drow incursions, adventurers -- we stand against all of it! We are the wall that will not break!
sequence.name: Hobgoblin Priest

sequence.text: We have no need to break your metaphorical wall, priest. Nor do we have any designs on your territory. Our offer still stands. Let us pass, and we'll pass in peace.
You will pass in pieces, human! I will put your heads on pikes as a warning to those who come after you. The Legion of Azrok will not be defeated!
sequence.name: Hobgoblin Priest

sequence.text: Think I heard 'nuff o' this tripe tha last time. Champions! Time ta finish this fight!
What are all these scraps of cloth lying around? It's like a rag shop exploded in here.
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: I'm not sure, Squiddly. But at a guess, this is clothing stripped from those who tried to take this route through Undermountain -- and who weren't as successful as we were getting past the threats here.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: [Signs]
sequence.name: Nat

sequence.text: Yes, Nat. I think that's a fine idea. Everyone, gather up what scraps you can. These people deserve to be remembered.
sequence.name: Ulkoria

sequence.text: Ms. Ulkoria! Mr. Jarlaxle! I hear something! It's those jabbering things! Those mouthering gibbers! Hang on, I wrote it down somewhere...
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: Close enough, Jenks. Everyone -- if you're gathering, gather quickly!
Look! Those gibbering mouthers are falling back! They're scared!
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: That's a mistake ye don't wanna make twice, lad. Them mouthers is aberrations. Most o' them don't know fear. So if they're fallin' back, it's fer somethin' else.
I see it. They're trying to draw us into position for something else behind them. Something big! Look out!
Can't remember tha last time I fought a manticore. Hope it's long 'nuff ta tha next time that I can say tha same again.
That was amazing...
sequence.name: Squiddly

sequence.text: That was terrifying!
sequence.name: Jenks

sequence.text: [Signs]
sequence.name: Nat

sequence.text: What did Nat say, Jarlaxle?
That it's funny how many things can be amazing and terrifying at the same time. That's a lesson well learned, I think.
Looks like we finally got a bit o' a breather either way. And hopefully when we get there, Skullport'll be less amazin' by half than this trip's been so far.

reset_currency_defines.name: Torm's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Torm, the god of duty and loyalty, revered by those who face danger to bring about a greater good.

properties.campaign_name: Grand Tour of the Sword Coast

reset_currency_defines.name: Chauntea's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Chauntea, the goddess of agriculture and the Great Mother, who is often worshipped by rural folk, especially during Highharvestide.

reset_currency_defines.name: Kelemvor's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Kelemvor, the lord of the dead, the judge of the damned, who despises the undead and seeks a peaceful transition for all.

reset_currency_defines.name: Leira's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Leira, the goddess of deception and illusions, who delights in the confusion sown by her various incarnations.

reset_currency_defines.name: Jergal's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Jergal, the final scribe, the pitiless one, the bleak seneschal, who abdicated control of the dead to three ambitious mortals.

reset_currency_defines.name: Shar's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Shar, the Mistress of the Night, the Dark Lady, Our Lady of Loss. The dark twin of Selune.

reset_currency_defines.name: Oghma's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Oghma, god of inspiration, invention, and knowledge. Their faithful spread knowledge and literacy far and wide.

reset_currency_defines.name: Eldath's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Eldath, a goddess of peace. Her presence is felt whereever there is calm.

reset_currency_defines.name: Sune's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Sune, the Lady of Love, the Princess of Passion. She is a deity of passion and delights of the senses.

reset_currency_defines.name: Umberlee's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Umberlee, the Bitch Queen, the Queen of the Depths, the Wavemother. Umberlee is feared by sailors and their loved ones alike.

reset_currency_defines.name: Lliira's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Lliira, Our Lady of Joy, Joybringer, Mistress of Revels. The beloved goddess of contentment, release, joy, happiness, dance, and freedom.

reset_currency_defines.name: Lathander's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Lathander, the god of spring, birth, and renewal. He is a god not of the sun, but of dawn, representing a new day full of promise.

reset_currency_defines.name: Rillifane's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Rillifane Rallathil, the elven deity of seasons.

reset_currency_defines.name: Gond's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Gond, gold of artifce, craft, and construction.

reset_currency_defines.name: Helm's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Helm, god of watchfulness.

reset_currency_defines.name: Waukeen's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Waukeen, our lady of gold.

reset_currency_defines.name: Mystra's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Mystra, the goddess of magic and possibilities.

reset_currency_defines.name: Asmodeus's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Admodeus, Lord of the Ninth Hells.

reset_currency_defines.name: Savras' Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Savras, god of divination and fortunetelling.

reset_currency_defines.name: Azuth's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Azuth, God of Wizardry.

reset_currency_defines.name: Tempus's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Tempus, the Lord of Battles.

reset_currency_defines.name: Tiamat's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Tiamat, the five-headed goddess of greed.

reset_currency_defines.name: Auril's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Auril, the Frostmaiden, the merciless goddess of cold and winter. Folk worship Auril to seek mercy from a hard winter.

reset_currency_defines.name: Bahamut's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Bahamut, eternal rival of Tiamat, his sister, and dragon god of justice.

reset_currency_defines.name: Corellon's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Corellon Larethian, Creator of the Elves.

reset_upgrade_defines.name: Comfortable in the Field of Triumph
